text:
*[Bug 18410] La.svd is non-deterministic*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18410>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED
         Resolution|---                         |Works as documented

--- Comment #11 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
It is good we have had this report,
so we all have seen that parallelized BLAS/Lapack do entail some very small
differences between runs, in that sense  very small randomness.

I agree this has been a surprise to many, as we'd known only about small
differences, between BLAS/Lapack implementations, notably optimizing ones.

Closing this now; for 'Reason', the possibilities are not so many, and I've
chosen  _"Works as documented"_  which is true in the sense that it is
documented that parallelization and optimization can lead to small differences
*and* in this case, the differences are seen even between different runs on
identical hardware and software -- but different state of the machine.
